hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Squeeze Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp, high-volume breakout from a prolonged period of low volatility (Bollinger Band Width < 0.1) is likely to be a false breakout and will reverse to the midpoint of the pre-breakout range within 3-7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound price action and low conviction. A high-volume breakout from a volatility squeeze often traps late momentum traders. The lack of a strong regime tailwind makes sustained trend continuation less likely, favoring a fade.
entry_conditions: BTC Bollinger Band Width (20,2) has been below 0.1 for at least 10 days
Price breaks above upper BB or below lower BB on a daily close with volume > 1.5x 20-day average
The breakout moves price to a new 10-day high/low

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the 20-day SMA (midpoint of pre-breakout range)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond the breakout day's high/low by 3% (confirms breakout)
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit at market close on the 7th trading day after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the price fails to revert to the 20-day SMA within 7 days more than 45% of the time after the signal occurs.
